definition: depot/supply station/supply point/staging post
to repair/to patch/to mend/to make up for/to fill (a vacancy)/to supplement
to supply/to provide
to/for/for the benefit of/to give/to allow/to do sth (for sb)/(grammatical equivalent of 被)/(grammatical equivalent of 把)/(sentence intensifier)
station/to stand/to halt/to stop/branch of a company or organization/website
ammunition depot

sentences.english: Dawn is expected to operate for eight or more years, and there are no refueling stations out there.
sentences.chinese: 曙光號預期工作8年以上，但那裏卻沒有燃料補給站。

sentences.english: The island is a staging -post for many visiting yachts on their way south.
sentences.chinese: 該島是很多觀光遊艇南行途中的一個補給站。

sentences.english: I can hack into their supply stores.
sentences.chinese: 我能入侵他們的補給站。

sentences.english: Each Main Event will be a time when the students will be filled with hope and encouragement.
sentences.chinese: 每次的溫心時間，都是加油鼓勵的希望補給站。

sentences.english: The bigger the depot, the bigger the fleet that can be hold.
sentences.chinese: 因此，補給站越到，能維持住的駐紮艦隊也就更大。

sentences.english: You will be able to raise the depot when units are on top.
sentences.chinese: 當有其他單位在補給站上方的時候，你也可以展開它。
